diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Hypertension, Psychiatric Disorders, Peripheral vascular disease s/p Left common femoral endarterectomy
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with left groin pain at the incision site following a left common femoral endarterectomy. A CT scan indicated a 2 cm fluid collection superficial to the common femoral artery, leading to a diagnosis of diverticulitis due to the signs and symptoms presented, despite no scans being currently available.
